form.label: What monitoring applications should be installed?
form.helpText: Select any number of the monitoring applications below to install them.

blocks.name: listSpaces
blocks.comment: Get a list of all spaces.

blocks.name: filterList
blocks.displayName: Filter over Qlik Cloud Services - List Spaces - Filter List
blocks.comment: Filter down to only Shared spaces.

blocks.name: filterList2
blocks.displayName: Filter over Qlik Cloud Services - List Spaces - Filter List 2
blocks.comment: Filter down to only Managed spaces.

form.label: Create new spaces or select from existing?
form.values: Select from existing spaces,Create new spaces
form.helpText: Whether new spaces should be created for the monitoring applications or if existing spaces should be used.

conditions.input1: {$.inputs3.'Create new spaces or select from existing?'}

form.label: Shared space to install monitoring application(s) into
form.helpText: Select a shared space to install the monitoring app(s) into. The default selection is the "Personal" space of the executing user.

form.label: Managed space to publish monitoring application(s) into
form.helpText: If the monitoring applications should be published to a space, select the Managed space here. The default is to not publish the app.

form.label: Shared space to install monitoring application(s) into name
form.helpText: Enter the name of the Shared space to install the monitoring application(s) into. This space will be created if it does not already exist. If no value is provided, the Personal space of the executing user will be used.

form.label: Managed space to publish monitoring application(s) into name
form.helpText: Enter the name of the Managed space to install the monitoring application(s) into. This space will be created if it does not already exist. If left empty, the application(s) will not be published.

form.label: Reload application(s) post-install?
form.helpText: Whether the {if: {$.publish} = 1, 'managed ',}applications should be reloaded post-installation process.

form.label: Generate API key automatically?
form.helpText: An API key needs to be created so that the monitoring applications' data connection can be created or potentially recreated if a matching API key was not found. If it is desired to do this manually, the API key can be entered manually in a following step.

form.label: API key for data connection creation
form.helpText: This step is manual as 'No' was selected from the previous step to do this automatically. Paste the generated API key here. Note that this will be excluded from the logs of this automation.

form.label: Reload start hour
form.helpText: Select the hour of the day in which to start the reload task.

form.label: Reload start minute
form.helpText: Select the minute of the hour in which to start the reload task.

form.label: Weekdays to run
form.helpText: This reload schedule will run on weekdays only. Select which weekdays to run the schedule on. If no selections are made, all weekdays will be auto-selected.

form.label: Should this installer add the Developer role to the executing user now?
form.helpText: The executing user ({$.getUser.name}) does not have the Developer role assigned, which is one of the prerequisites for the Qlik Cloud monitoring applications. This role is required to proceed as API keys are required for the data connection, and in order to create an API key, the Developer role is required. If 'No' is selected, this step will need to be done manually and the installer will exit. Note that the installer will still stop after this step regardless as it is required that the user log out and log back in for the role change to propagate in Qlik Application Automation.

blocks.name: condition
blocks.comment: Should the Developer role be auto-applied?

conditions.input1: {$.inputs2.'Should this installer add the Developer role to the executing user now?'}

blocks.name: condition11
blocks.comment: Are API keys enabled on the tenant?

blocks.name: inputs10
blocks.comment: Should this installer enable API keys on this tenant?

form.label: Should this installer enable API keys on this tenant now?
form.helpText: API keys are not currently enabled on this tenant, which is a prerequisite of the installer. An API key is required to create the data connection to Qlik Cloud that the monitoring applications leverage. If 'No' is selected, this will need to be done manually, and the installer will exit.

conditions.input1: {$.inputs10.'Should this installer enable API keys on this tenant now?'}

form.label: Proceed

blocks.name: condition22
blocks.comment: Does the executing user have a professional entitlement?

form.label: Should this installer allocate a Professional entitlement to the executing user now?
form.helpText: The executing user ({$.getUser.name}) does not have a "Professional" license entitlement assigned to them, which is one of the prerequisites of the Qlik Cloud monitoring applications. Note that the installer will still stop after this step as it is required that the user log out and log back in for the entitlement change to propagate.

blocks.name: stop5
blocks.comment: Stop the installer as the user will need to log out and log back in for the change to propagate.

blocks.name: output16
blocks.comment: Log out and log back in.

inputs.value: Please log out of Qlik Cloud and log back in for the entitlement change to propagate. Exiting the installer...

conditions.input1: {$.inputs12.'Should this installer allocate a Professional entitlement to the executing user now?'}

blocks.name: condition24
blocks.comment: Will the applications be created in an existing Shared space?

conditions.input1: { $.inputs15.'Should this installer add the "Can edit" role to executing user?' }

inputs.value: "Can edit" is a required on the Shared space to create an application within it. Please ensure this is applied, and then run the installer again. Exiting the installer...

form.label: Should this installer add the "Can edit" role to executing user?
form.helpText: The executing user ({$.getUser.name}) does not have the "Can edit" permission on the Shared space "{$.lookupItemInList6.name}". This permission is required so that applications can be created (and reloaded if not published) within this space. If 'No' is selected, this installer will exit.

blocks.name: condition27
blocks.comment: Will the applications be published to an existing space?

blocks.name: condition28
blocks.comment: Does the user not have "Can publish"?

form.label: Should this installer add the "Can publish" role to the executing user?
form.helpText: The executing user ({ $.getUser.name }) does not have the "Can publish" permission on the Managed space "{$.lookupItemInList7.name}". This permission is required so that applications can be published to this space. If 'No' is selected, this installer will exit.

conditions.input1: { $.inputs13.'Should this installer add the "Can publish" role to the executing user?' }

inputs.value: "Can publish" is required on the Managed space to publish an application to it. If it is desired to not publish the applications, re-run this installer and choose to not publish them. If it is desired to change the permissions manually, re-run this installer after the fact. Exiting the installer...

blocks.name: condition30
blocks.comment: Does the user not have "Can manage"?

form.label: Should this installer add the Can manage role to the executing user?
form.helpText: The executing user ({$.getUser.name}) does not have the "Can manage" permission on the Managed space "{$.lookupItemInList7.name}". This permission is required to both reload applications and create reload schedules within the space. If 'No' is selected, the installer will continue, however there will not be the ability to create the reload schedules or reload the applications through this process.

conditions.input1: {$.inputs14.'Should this installer add the Can manage role to the executing user?'}

form.label: Create daily reload schedule(s)?
form.helpText: Whether or not to create reload schedules for the monitoring applications. This schedule will be defined in a later step. Note that a schedule will be created for the Managed applications only, unless the applications are not to be published, in which case the schedule will be created on the Shared or Personal space applications.

blocks.name: condition32
blocks.comment: Can the user create a reload schedule?

form.label: What should the maximum API key expiration be set to in days?
form.helpText: Note that the API key will need to be rotated for the data connection that the monitoring applications use within the timeframe that is set. This can be an automated process, but will need to be run within the window set above.

form.label: Delete existing monitoring applications API key so that a new one may be created for the required data connection?
form.helpText: An API key already exists for the executing user named '{$.apiKeyName}'. This key needs to be deleted as the corresponding data connection 'monitoring_apps_REST' was not found in the space '{ $.targetSpaceName }'. If 'No' is selected, the installer will exit. If 'Yes' is selected, it will be deleted replaced with a new API key with the same name so that the new key can be used.

This installer handles both new installations and upgrades of the Qlik Cloud Monitoring applications.

form.label: Delete the existing monitoring_apps_REST data connection?
form.helpText: The data connection 'monitoring_apps_REST' already exists in the space, however a corresponding API key does not. This means that either the corresponding API key has been deleted or the API key was entered manually to create the data connection. If 'Yes' is selected, the data connection will be deleted and recreated along with a new corresponding API key. If 'No' is selected, the automation will continue to run but will not delete the data connection, as it will assume it is operational considering that the key could have been manually entered in a previous installer run.

form.helpText: All of the selected applications have already been installed, however some are eligible for an upgrade: {implode: {$.appsUpgradeableNames}}. These applications can either be upgraded side-by-side (new published copies) or can publish and replace the older version(s). The source (origin) applications will be renamed, removed of their QCMA tags, and their reload schedules will also be removed. If upgraded side-by-side, the same process will be applied to the older versions of the published apps.

form.helpText: Some of the selected applications have not been installed: {implode: {$.compareLists}}. Additionally, some of the selected applications have already been installed and are eligible for an upgrade: {implode: {$.appsUpgradeableNames}}. These applications can either be upgraded side-by-side (new published copies) or can publish and replace the older version(s). The source (origin) applications will be renamed, removed of their QCMA tags, and their reload schedules will also be removed. If upgraded side-by-side, the same process will be applied to the older versions of the published apps. Choose whether to install new applications only, upgrade eligible applications only, or both.
